description.narrative: IFC is supporting expansion of organized food retail in the lower-income consumer segments in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro and North Macedonia (the Target Balkan Countries) and addressing investment needs in the food retail sector in Romania and Moldova (the Project).

The Project will enhance access to quality affordable food in the Target Balkan Countries, create jobs, including for vulnerable population and Ukrainian migrants, and contribute to strengthening the food supply chain in all project countries. The Project will also promote market competitiveness in the Target Balkan Countries by increasing penetration of modern retail and by demonstrating higher performance standards for energy efficiency in new stores and warehouses built as part of the Project.

name.narrative: Investments under the Project are planned to be made in different cities of Romania, Moldova and the Target Balkan Countries of Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro and North Macedonia.
